cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles W of Cancun, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the southern and central Gulf, then curving north-northwest toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast, likely between Vermilion Bay and Cameron

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coast eastward into Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) with a 15% chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds and hurricane-force gusts possible Friday afternoon–night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 3–6 ft possible along the Mississippi River Delta and Plaquemines Parish coast Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with localized totals up to 12 inches Friday–Saturday, creating flash-flood risk and operational disruptions.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands and very rough seas/large waves in the approaches to Southwest Pass and nearby anchorages.
